title: The Mad Man’s Bag
content:
The mad man has a pan and a bag.
The bag has a map.
The jam is in the pan.

title: The Fat Cat and the Rat
content:
The cat is fat.
The fat cat has a rat.
The rat ran to the bag and the cat sat on the mat.

title: Nat the Fat Cat
content:
Nat is a fat cat.
Nat had a rat and a pan.
The pan had jam.
Nat sat on a mat and had a nap.
The rat ran.

title: A Nap on the Dam
content:
The man and the cat have a map.
The map is a rag and it has jam.
The man and the cat ran to the dam.
The man and the cat sat on the dam and had a nap on it.

title: A Bad Van for Sam
content:
Sam is a man.
Sam has a van.
The van is bad. Sam is sad.

title: Nat and Tam
content:
Nat and Tam are cats.
Tam has ham.
Nat is sad.
Nat had a nap on a rag.

title: The Van with the Map
content:
Lan has a van.
A map is in the van.
Lan has a map.
Lan ran to the dam.

title: The Ram and the Yam
content:
Zak is a ram.
Zak has a pan in the bag.
The pan has yam and jam.

title: The Fat Ram and Sam
content:
Sam has a ram.
The ram is fat.
The fat ram ran to Sam.
Sam is mad.

title: The Red Hen
content:
This is my pet.
It is a hen.
My hen is red.

title: The Hen and the Red Net
content:
I see a man that have my pet.
I want my pet.
My pet is a hen that has a red net.

title: The Wet Bed
content:
You and I are men.
You and I want ten pegs.
The pegs are on the bed.
The bed is wet.

title: My Pets are Red
content:
I have hens.
I like my hens.
Hens are pets.
You see the pet hens?
My hens are red.

title: The Vet and the Net
content:
I met the men in the vets.
The men want to see the vet.
The vet sees a red hen in a net.

title: Pens on a Web
content:
I have a red hen.
It sees ten legs.
The ten legs are pens.
The pens are on a web.

title: A Red Jet for Ted
content:
Ted is a red hen.
Ted gets set on the jet.
The jet is red.
The jet gets in a web.

title: The Fat Cat and the Vet
content:
The fat cat has a bad leg.
I see a vet.
The vet sees the fat cat.
The fat cat had a nap on the bed.

title: The Mad Men and the Jam
content:
The rat and the hen ran to the men.
The men are mad.
The hen and the rat want jam.
The jam is in the men’s bag.

title: A Sad Rat in a Web
content:
Nat is a mad bat.
Nat sees a rat.
Nat wants it.
The rat is in the web.
The rat is sad.

title: Ham in the Pan for Sed
content:
Sed is my pet.
Sed is a red cat.
Sed wants to get the ham in the pan.
Sed is a bad cat.
(Don’t be like sed).

title: Sam’s Ten Pens
content:
Sam wants ten pens.
The pens are on the rag.
The rag is on the bed.
Sam sees the pens.
Sam ran to the bed.

title: The Dig and the Fig
content:
The small kid digs.
She digs up figs.
She has the big figs in a bin.
The bin has a rip.
The kid wants to fix the bin.

title: The Pig in the Tin
content:
The big pig hit the bin.
A kid sees the big pig.
The pig hid in the tin.
The kid wants to fix the tin bin.

title: The Fin in the Pit
content:
Rit and Nik are small kids.
They did rip the fin.
They hid the fin in the pit.

title: The Kit in the Pit
content:
The men dig a small pit.
They see a kit in the small pit.
They sit in the small pit and dig up the kit.
The men have the kit.

title: Ten Bags of Jam
content:
The ten kids have small red bags.
The small red bags have figs and jam.
The figs are bad.
The kids are sad.

title: A Nap in the Pit
content:
Ted is a tin man that has a red tag.
Ted sees a small sad kid in a pit.
The kid and Ted sat in the pit and had a nap.

title: A Nap on the Mat
content:
Nik sat on the bed.
Nik had a fat cat.
The cat sat on the mat.
Nik and the cat had a nap.

title: The Cop and the Dog
content:
Bob is a cop.
Bob has a dog on the job.
The dog wants a log.
Bob sees a log.
Now, the dog has a log.

title: A Box on a Log
content:
I am a cop with a hot dog.
I got a box on a log.
I see fog on top of the hot dog.
Yes, I have a job to hop a lot.

title: The Fox Got the Log
content:
Tom is a fox.
Tom wants a log.
Bob the dog has a log.
Tom got the log from Bob.
Now, Bob sobs.

title: The Hog in the Fog
content:
You like pop in a box?
No, I do not want hot pop.
I see a hog.
It hops in the fog and pops the dots.

title: The Sad Dog
content:
Tom is a cat and Bob is a dog.
Tom hid the ham from Bob.
Bob wants the ham.
Now, Bob is sad.

title: Mom’s Big Job
content:
Mom is a vet.
Mom has a small sad dog on the job.
The dog ran in the fog.
The dog is mad.

title: A Lot in the Pot
content:
I have got a pot.
The pot is hot. It is a hot pot.
We all got hotdogs from the pot.
Now, we do not have a lot in the pot.

title: The Bad Fox and the Good Dog
content:
Bob is a bad fox.
Bob likes hens.
Bob got the hens in a net. Tom the dog saw Bob.
Tom hit Bob and got the hens back.

title: Tom and His Dog
content:
Tom is a small boy.
Tom can hop on the logs.
Tom has a dog.
Tom digs for the logs with his dog.

title: The Box Under the Rug
content:
I am a pup with a red box.
My box is under the rug.
I tug and tug to get the box.
But I cannot get it.

title: The Pup and the Rug
content:
I am a pup with a red box.
My box is under the rug.
I tug and tug to get the box.
But I cannot get it.

title: A Big Mug for a Pet
content:
Do You like my mug?
It is big and has a pup in it.
You can get a mug if you want.
Your mug can have a pet cat or a pet dog in it.

title: The Pup in the Mud
content:
I am a kid with a hat and a bag. 
My dog ran on the rug. 
He met a wet pup in the mud. 
Now, we have to get the pup.

title: The Men at the Dam
content:
We met sad men at the dam.
They have nets and big tin cans to get bugs.
But the men get no bugs.
Just a wet leg in the mud.

title: The Cop in the Mud
content:
The fat cop ran to get the bad man.
But he sat on a rag!
His hat got a rip as he hit the mud.
The man in the van got in the fog.

title: The Hen and the Bug
content:
She puts jam on her bun in the sun.
A bug did sit on her lip.
The hen ran to get the bug.
She did not like it!

title: The Bug in the Web
content:
You see the top of the web?
The big fat bug is in it.
It has a bug.
But, the bug will not get off the web.

title: Cake for the Ram
content:
An Ape’s Cake.
A little ape made a cake for the ram.
What was in the cake?
Some nuts, figs and jam.
“Do you like my cake, little ram?”
”Yes, I do, little ape! Let’s make some cake for the hens too!”

title: The Ram and the Lake
content:
A fast Ram.
A fat cat can sit on the gate.
A little hen can sit on the cane.
A male ape can sit on a rake.
Can a mad ram sit on the vase?
No, it cannot, but it can jump and run to the lake!

title: A Cake for Sale
content:
A Cake on Sale.
A fox will hop in the fog to find his box.
A hog will take some jam and make a cake.
A ram will take the cake and put it in the box.
An ape will take the cake in the box and put it on sale.

title: The Pig and the Hen
content:
Not a Fun Game.
A hen met a big pig in a cave.
“Come here, let’s have a fun game!”.
I have a cane and you have a cup.
We can tape the cup to the cane.
The big pig did not like the game.

title: The Cave and the Dog
content:
Mad Ape.
We can have some fun!
Let’s go to the cave and make a gate.
Like this, the ape cannot come.
It will be mad and ask a dog for help.
The dog will dig under the gate and save the ape.

title: A Cat and an Ape-1
content:
A Cat and an Ape.
The little ape is sad.
“Help!” The male cat jumps and takes the ape down from the tree.
The ape is safe now.
The little ape takes the cat to its hut and bakes a big fig cake.

title: A Cat and an Ape-2
content:
The ape is safe now.
The little ape takes the cat to its hut and bakes a big fig cake.

title: Tate Hates the Lake-1
content:
Tate Hates the Lake.
Kate sees Tate in the lake.
Tate is wet and sad.
She hates the lake.
Kate wants to help Tate.

title: Tate Hates the Lake-2
content:
So, she hugs Tate and they zip to the cave for a game.
The game is fun.
Tate is not sad.

title: Mike and the Dime-1
content:
Mike is a kid.
Mike finds a dime in a cave.
Mike looks at the big dime.
Mike takes the dime and jumps in the van to his Dad.

title: Mike and the Dime-2
content:
His dad’s name is kile.
Kile takes the dime to the cops.

title: The Fine Red Bike
content:
Mike has a fine red bike.
He rides it to the lake.
“I like my red fine bike,” Mike says.
He rides up a hill and down.
“What a fun ride!”

title: Mike has a wife
content:
Mike has a wife and five kids.
The kids play with the kites in the hut.
They have a small cat and a dog.
Mike takes a nap on a pile of pines.
Mike and his wife have ten hens and nine pigs.

title: Pigs and hens
content:
The pigs are fat and the hens are mad.
The hens go with the dog in a line and hide in a pile of ripe limes.
The pigs jump in the mud.
The pigs are bad.

title: Limes in the Cave-1
content:
Mike is a pup.
Mike likes to dig under the big red van.
Mike finds five ripe limes and nine logs.

title: Limes in the Cave-2
content: Mike takes the five limes and the nine logs to his cave.

title: Time to Hike!
content:
Kile and Nate go for a hike.
“It is time to hike,” Nate says.
They walk up a big hill.
“I like this hike,” Kile says.

title: The Wide Slide
content:
Jake and Zike see a wide slide.
“Let’s go on the slide,” Zike says.
They get on the slide and down.
“This is fun!” Zike says.

title: A Bone for Home
content:
Jones Sees a bone.
He took the bone home.
The bone was old.
Jones gave the bone to his dog.
The dog loves the bone.

title: The Bad Joke
content:
Jones said a joke.
The joke was bad.
Jones made a note.
The note had the joke.
His friends hated the joke.

title: The Mole in the Hole
content:
Jones sees a mole.
The mole dug a hole.
Jones gave a bone to the mole.
The mole was cute.
The hole was big.

title: The Mole and the bike-1
content:
A mole found a hole.
The mole poked his nose.
He saw a cone.

title: The Mole and the bike-2
content:
The mole rode his bike.
He found a note.
He tied the note to a rope.

title: the mole and the rose
content:
The mole has a home.
The hose broke.
The mole rode a bike.
He found a rope.
He tied the rope.
The wife gave a rose. .

title: The Mole's Nose-1
content:
The mole saw a hole.
He saw a nose.
The nose poked the mole.
The mole found a note.

title: The Mole's Nose-2
content:
He tied the note.
They told a joke.
The mole took a doze.

title: The Nose in the Hole-1
content:
The mole rode a bike.
She saw a hole.
A hose lay near.
The mole poked the nose.

title: The Nose in the Hole-2
content:
The wife had a note.
They told a joke.
The mole took a doze.

title: The Mule at Home-1
content:
A huge mule was sad.
He wants his friends to come and have fun in his home.
His friends did not come, the huge mule was sad that he puked.

title: The Mule at Home-2
content:
His mom came and gave him a huge hug.
The sad huge mule is happy.

title: Huge Mad Dog-1
content:
cute cat sat by the huge mad dog.
The cute cat wanted to say hello to the huge mad dog.
The huge mad dog was not mad but sad.

title: Huge Mad Dog-2
content:
The cat said a fun joke to the huge sad dog.
Now the huge sad dog is happy.

title: Mike and the Cute Dog-1
content:
Mike sees a cute little dog.
The cute little dog is happy and wants to play.
The cute little dog jumps up and down, but then he pukes!

title: Mike and the Cute Dog-2
content:
“Bad dog!” Mike says.
But then he gives me a cute look, and I can’t be mad.

title: A Fuse for the Tube-1
content:
A mule has a huge cube.
The mule rode by the dome.
It used a fuse for the tube.
The cube gave out some fume.

title: A Fuse for the Tube-2
content:
The mule saw a cute rose.
He tied the rope with the fuse.
It is time for fun.

title: The Mule and the Mute Pup-1
content:
The mule sat by the dome.
A cube lay near the tube.
The fuse broke with some fume.

title: The Mule and the Mute Pup-2
content:
The mule rode home in the sun.
He saw a cute mute pup.
He used a tube to help.
The mule felt hope.

title: The Fuse and The fume-1
content:
The fuse gave out a huge fume.
The mule rode past the dome.
He used the tube and cube.

title: The Fuse and The fume-2
content:
The mule found a cute pup.
He tied the rope on the pole.
The mule felt hope and smiled.
The mute mule did not puke.

title: Fun by the Dome-1
content:
The cube was huge.
The mule rode by the dome.
The fuse gave out a fume.
The mule used the tube with hope.

title: Fun by the Dome-2
content:
> He tied the rope on the pole.
The mule found a cute pup.
They sat and had fun.

title: A Tune for June-1
content:
A dude rode to the dune.
He saw a big dome.
The dude played a tune on his lute.
The tube held air from June.

title: A Tune for June-2
content:
He felt hope by the dune.
He smiled at a mute mule.
The tune made the day fun.

title: The Dude and the Lute-1
content:
The dude sat by the dune.
He saw a tube near the dome.
The mute mule rode by the dune.
The dude played his lute.

title: The Dude and the Lute-2
content:
A fuse gave out some fume.
The dude used hope to fix it.
He liked the happy tune.

title: A Sunny Day in June-1
content:
The dude rode past the big dome.
He found a mute mule by the dune.
He played a tune on the lute.
The tube held air from June.

title: A Sunny Day in June-2
content:
The mule felt hope and smiled.
The dude liked the tune.
The sun shone bright in June.

title: The Boy and the Dune-1
content:
The boy sees a little dune.
He jumps on it and says “Hi”.
A girl comes and looks at him.
She wants to jump too.

title: The Boy and the Dune-2
content: They are happy friends now.

title: Hope by the Big Dome-1
content:
The dude saw a huge dune.
She sat by the dome and played a lute.
The tube let out some fume.
The dude rode by on a mule.

title: Hope by the Big Dome-2
content:
He smiled and hummed a tune.
He had hope for the day.
They sat by the big dune.

title: The Dude and the Mute Mule-1
content:
The dude rode to the big dome.
The mule sat by the dune.
The dude played a lute and tune.
The tube gave out a fume.
T

title: The Dude and the Mute Mule-2
content:
the dude smiled and felt hope.
The mule looked mute but calm.
The sun shone over the dune.

title: A Dude and A Mule-1
content:
A dude rode by the dune and dome.
He played a lute and hummed a tune.
The tube let out some fume.
The dude felt hope and smiled.

title: A Dude and A Mule-2
content:
The mule sat quiet by the dome.
The dude liked the happy tune.
The sun was warm in June.

title: Blue Plane-1
content:
I see a blue plane.
It is big and flat.
The plane can glide in the sky.
A man is in the plane.
He has a map and a bag.
He is glad to go.
The plane goes up and up.

title: Blue Plane-2
content:
It can slide on the wind.
The man can see the globe.
The plane comes down.
It lands on a flat spot.
The man is glad and says, “I did it!”

title: The Big Class Plan-1
content:
The class is big.
The kids sit in a line.
They clap and say, “Hi!”
The girl has a red pen.
She can make a plum on the map.
The boy says, “That is glad!”

title: The Big Class Plan-2
content:
The class looks at the map.
They put a blue tag on it.
They are happy with the plan.
The teacher says, “Good job!”
The class claps again.
They all say, “We are glad!”

title: The Dog and the Sled-1
content:
I have a black dog.
He has a red sled.
We go up the flat hill.

title: The Dog and the Sled-2
content:
We get on the sled.
It can slide fast.
The dog is glad.
We stop by a log.
The dog jumps off.
I say, “Good job, pup!”

title: The Dog and the Sled-3
content:
We go up again.
We slide one more time.
We are happy now.

title: Flip the Pet Pig-1
content:
Flip is my pet pig.
He can run and hop.
He is glad to play.

title: Flip the Pet Pig-2
content:
I have a plum for Flip.
He sees it and sits.
He likes the plum.

title: Flip the Pet Pig-3
content:
Flip gets the plum.
He eats it fast.
He looks at me and nods.

title: Flip the Pet Pig-4
content:
I pat him.
He is a good pig.
We sit by the van and rest.

title: The Brave Crab and the Frog-1
content:
A crab is on the sand.
He has a bag with a red grape in it.
He sees a frog by the rock.
The frog says, “You are brave.”

title: The Brave Crab and the Frog-2
content:
The crab grins and claps.
He wants to cross the wet grass.
The frog jumps and says, “Come on!”
The crab runs fast on the grass.

title: The Brave Crab and the Frog-3
content:
They get to a big rock.
The crab is glad and grins.
The frog claps for his friend.
They sit on the rock in the sun.

title: The Truck and the Track-1
content:
A boy and his dad have a truck.
They put a bag and a box in it.
The boy sits by the window.
They drive on the track by the grass.
The boy sees a frog and a crane.
He says, “This is a fun day!”

title: The Truck and the Track-2
content:
The truck stops by a big rock.
They take out the bag and eat a plum.
The boy claps and says, “Yum!”

title: The Truck and the Track-3
content:
The dad says, “You help me a lot.”
The boy says, “I am glad, dad.”
They drive home in the truck.

title: A Grape in the Frame-1
content:
The class has a plan for a prize.
Pam says, “Let’s make a frame.”
Dan says, “Yes, we can!”
Pam puts a red grape in the frame.
Dan claps and says, “It looks good!”

title: A Grape in the Frame-2
content:
The class stands by the desk.
The boys press the frame to the wall.
The class looks at it.
They are all glad and grin.

title: A Grape in the Frame-3
content:
Pam says, “We did a fine job.”
Dan says, “It is our pride.”
The class claps and says, “Thank you!”

title: The Frog and the Drum-1
content:
A frog has a drum.
He hits it and makes a big tune.
A pig stands by him.
The frog plays and plays.
The drum broke, and the frog is sad.

title: The Frog and the Drum-2
content:
The pig runs to help him.
The pig puts a rope on the drum.
He fixes it with a small cup.
The frog grins and says, “Good!”

title: The Frog and the Drum-3
content:
The frog hits the drum again.
The pig claps, and they jump.
They are both happy friends.

title: The Snake and the Swan-1
content:
A snake is on a stone by the lake.
He sees a swan that swims near him.
The snake smiles and says, “Hi!”
The swan says, “You smile so well!”

title: The Snake and the Swan-2
content:
The snake spins his tail on the sand.
They both grin.
The swan swings her wings in the sun.
The snake sniffs a rose by the rock.
They are happy friends.

title: The Snake and the Swan-3
content:
The snake goes under the rock.
The swan swims in the lake.
The swan swims away with a smile.

title: Tim and the New Skate-1
content:
Tim has a new skate.
He puts it on and stands up.
He can skate fast on the track.
His mom sees him and says, “Take care. Go slow, Tim!”

title: Tim and the New Skate-2
content:
Tim smiles and says, “I can do it!”
He spins and stops at the step.
His dad claps and says, “Good job!”
Tim grins and skates again.

title: Tim and the New Skate-3
content:
He gets a bag from the van.
He puts his skate in the bag.
He says, “This was a fun day!”

title: The Dog and the Red Spot-1
content:
A dog has a red spot on his leg.
He sniffs it and sits by the door.
His mom comes to see him.
She says, “You are a good dog.”

title: The Dog and the Red Spot-2
content:
The dog grins and wags The dog grins and stands by her.
She puts a cup of milk for him.
The milk looks good.
He sniffs it and sips it all.

title: The Dog and the Red Spot-3
content:
The dog sits on the rug.
He sniffs the air and smiles.
He is a happy dog.

title: The Smoke by the Gate-1
content:
The kids see smoke by the gate.
“It’s black!” says the girl.
The boy says, “Let’s go see it!”
They walk and stop by the stone.

title: The Smoke by the Gate-2
content:
The smoke spins up in the sky.
“Oh no!” says the boy.
A woman comes with a hose.
She puts water on the smoke.

title: The Smoke by the Gate-3
content:
It goes away fast.
The kids smile and say, “Thank you!”
The woman grins and says, “You are brave.”
The day is safe and happy now.

title: The Dolphin and the Whale-1
content:
I see a dolphin in the lake.
He jumps up and gets a fish.
The dolphin goes by a ship.
A whale is with the dolphin.

title: The Dolphin and the Whale-2
content:
They swim and go under the ship.
They look at the man on the shop.
The man has a phone in his bag.
He takes a photo of them

title: The Dolphin and the Whale-3
content:
.
He puts the photo by them.
The dolphin and whale get the photo.
They grin and jump by the lake.
They are happy to be friends.

title: The Man and the White Ship-1
content:
A man has a white ship.
He goes to the shop by the lake.
He needs a rope and a bag.
The shop has a rope and a map.

title: The Man and the White Ship-2
content:
He picks the rope and the map.
He takes them to the ship.
He puts the rope in the bag.

title: The Man and the White Ship-3
content:
He gets on the ship with his bag.
He can go on the lake.
The ship is on the lake with the man.
He grins and looks at the map.
He thinks this is a good day to go.

title: The Chick and the Chip-1
content:
A chick is on the box.
It sees a chip on the box.
The chick wants the chip.
The chick picks up the chip.

title: The Chick and the Chip-2
content:
It takes a bite of the chip.
The chip is a bit on one side.
Oh no — the chip drops in the mud.
The chick is sad and sits down

title: The Chick and the Chip-3
content:
.
The mom hen comes to help.
The hen brings a new chip.
She puts it by the chick.
The chick eats the chip and grins.

title: A Photo of the Dog-1
content:
I have a phone in my bag.
I take a photo of the dog.
The dog sits and looks at me.
I put the phone on the bed.

title: A Photo of the Dog-2
content:
I pick up the photo and put it by mom.
Mom gets the photo.
Mom looks at the photo of the dog.
She says, “This is a photo.

title: A Photo of the Dog-3
content:
”
Dad comes and gets the phone.
They look at the photo and grin.
They say, “That is a nice photo.”
I am happy with my phone.

title: The Frog and the Spring-1
content:
I see a spring by the stream.
A frog sits on a log.
It is a big green frog.
The frog jumps in the spring.
It makes a splash on the wet sand.

title: The Frog and the Spring-2
content:
I get my red cup and sit by it.
Dad and I look at the frog.
He says it can swim fast.
I say, “Yes, I see it go!”

title: The Frog and the Spring-3
content:
The frog hops on the land.
It sits under a shrub.
Then it jumps back in the stream.

title: The Sprites and the Shrub-1
content:
Three sprites live by a shrub.
They sit on a soft bed of mud.
One sprite has a red hat.
They play by the stream.
One jumps and makes a splash.
The small sprite gets wet.

title: The Sprites and the Shrub-2
content:
They run up the hill and stop.
The sun is up, and it is hot.
They sit and sip from a cup.

title: The Sprites and the Shrub-3
content:
The sprites see a frog swim.
They say, “It is fun to be here.”
Then they go back to the shrub.

title: The Square Cake and the Jam-1
content:
Mom bakes a square cake.
She puts jam on top.
Dad and I sit at the big table.
She cuts the cake into nine bits.

title: The Square Cake and the Jam-2
content:
We each get one on a plate.
It looks good and smells nice.
I take a bite and smile.
Dad says, “This is the best!”
Mom says, “I’m glad you like it.”

title: The Square Cake and the Jam-3
content:
The cake is all gone.
Mom picks up the cups and plates.
We all say, “Thank you, Mom!”

title: The Fish and the Thrill-1
content:
A boy and a girl walk by a shrub.
They see a fish in the stream.
The girl says, “It is so big!”
The boy wants to get the fish.
He gets a net from his bag.

title: The Fish and the Thrill-2
content:
He stands by the spring.
The fish swims fast and hides.
The boy says, “Oh no, it’s gone!”

title: The Fish and the Thrill-3
content:
The girl says, “Let’s try again.
” He dips the net in the stream.
The fish is in the net now.
They jump and say, “What a thrill!”

title: The Gold Ring and the King-1
content:
Boy Tom was at the bank.
He liked to dig in the sand in front of the big door.
He put his hand in the cold sand and found something.
“Oh no! It is cold,” said Tom.
The cold thing was a gold ring!

title: The Gold Ring and the King-2
content:
He held it tight in his hand.
“Dad! Look what I have!” said Tom.
His dad said, “It is a big, old gold ring.”
Tom was happy to hold it.
The king came.
He said, “I need to find my long gold ring! It’s gone!”
Tom held up the ring abd said, “Is this your ring, King?”

title: The Gold Ring and the King-3
content:
The king said, “Yes! Thank you, little boy!” The king was happy and gave Tom a new toy.
Tom said, “I will go hunt for a plant now!”
He walked home happy with his dad.

title: The Pink Quilt and the Pink Belt-1
content:
Lily, the girl, wants a new quilt for her bed.
She and her mom went on a hunt.
They found a pink quilt that she liked.
She said, “I want this quilt!”

title: The Pink Quilt and the Pink Belt-2
content:
They walked out and saw a big band.
The band began to sing a long, happy song on the front street.
The man with the trumpet had a pink belt on!
The band stopped.
The man said, “Oh no! My pink belt is gone!”

title: The Pink Quilt and the Pink Belt-3
content:
Lily looked down.
The belt was on the ground by her foot.
She picked it up with her hand.
Lily gave the pink belt to the man.
He said, “Thank you, little girl! Now we can sing more!”
Lily was happy she could help.
She went to sleep under her new pink quilt.

title: The Pink Fish and the Plant-1
content:
I like to play with water.
I put my hand in the cold sink water.
I saw a small, pink toy fish in the sink!
I held it up.
It was wet and cold.

title: The Pink Fish and the Plant-2
content:
My mom was with her plant.
The plant needed water.
She said, “The dirt is dry. We need to put some water on it so it will grow long.”
I took the pink fish out.
I said, “Mom, can we use this cold water for the plant?”
She said, “Yes, good idea!”

title: The Pink Fish and the Plant-3
content:
We poured the water on the plant.
The plant was happy.
I put the fish safe on the counter.
I saw that the plant was not big, but it will grow.

title: The King and the Sand Castle-1
content:
The king was at the beach.
He wanted to build a big sand castle.
He used both his hands to pat down the sand.
He said, “I will make the biggest castle in the front!”

title: The King and the Sand Castle-2
content:
The sun was hot.
The king said, “Oh no! The sand castle is going to melt!”
He yelled, “Help! We need to hold the sand together!”
A small band was playing nearby.
The king asked, “Can you put down your drums and help me?”
The man said, “Yes, King!

title: The King and the Sand Castle-3
content:
We will come and help you!”
They all worked together to make a very long wall.
The king was happy.
He said, “Thank you, friends! I will sing a song for you now!”
The king began to sing a long, silly song.

title: A Gift on the Shelf-1
content:
The elf was small.
He had a soft gift in his hand.
He wanted to give the gift to the girl.
He said, “Hello, I need help!”
The girl said, “Put the gift on the shelf by the sink.”
The elf put the gift up.

title: A Gift on the Shelf-2
content:
He did not want the water to infect the silk ribbon.
The elf was thirsty.
He said, “I want cold milk to gulp.”
The girl gave him the milk.

title: A Gift on the Shelf-3
content:
He drank the milk.
The elf left a pact for her under the shelf.
The pact said: “I will always help you.”
The girl was very happy.

title: The Wolf and the Elk-1
content:
A big wolf was on the hunt.
He saw an elk make a sad yelp.
The elk’s leg was hurt.
The wolf felt sorry.
The elk said, “I need help!”

title: The Wolf and the Elk-2
content:
The wolf had to act fast.
He found some soft grass for the elk to lie down.
The wolf came back.
He made a pact: “I will not eat you. We are friends now.”

title: The Wolf and the Elk-3
content:
The elk stopped his yelp.
The wolf left and came back with the elk’s father and mother.
The wolf did a very good work!

title: The Lamp and the Camp-1
content:
The boy and his dad went to camp.
They had a big lamp for night.
The boy said, “I left my rope at home!”
His dad said, “Don’t be sad.0 We can jump up and get it from the high shelf tomorrow.”

title: The Lamp and the Camp-2
content:
They turned on the lamp.
The boy wanted to jump over the log.
His dad said, “Do not do that act!”

title: The Lamp and the Camp-3
content:
The boy got his soft quilt.
The lamp made the tent glow pink.
His dad said, “Sleeps well.”

title: The Silk Dress and the Gift-1
content:
The woman has a new dress of soft, pink silk.
She said, “This is a gift for my girl.”
She put the gift in a box.
The girl came home.

title: The Silk Dress and the Gift-2
content:
She said, “I am very thirsty! I need to gulp cold milk.”
She poured a cup at the sink.
Her mother gave her the silk gift.

title: The Silk Dress and the Gift-3
content:
The girl was very happy.
She said, “I will not let germs infect this new dress.”
She put the dress under the shelf.
She came back to her mother.
She gave her mother a hug and said, “Thank you!”

title: The Best Fish Dish-1
content:
Mom will cook fish today.
She said, “I want to make the best fish dish for lunch.”
She had to act fast to get the fish.
The fish was the last dish to make.

title: The Best Fish Dish-2
content:
The boy said, “Mom, I want to help you put the fish on the pink dish.”
She said, “Thank you, my boy!”
He put his hand on the hot dish and took a big gasp!
“Oh no! It’s hot!”
He made a yelp.

title: The Best Fish Dish-3
content:
His mom put the dish on the desk to cool.
The cold dish was safe now.
The family sat down to eat lunch.
It was the best fish they had ever eaten.

title: The Pink Flask and the Desk-1
content:
The girl was at work.
She had a big desk.
On the desk, she had a pink flask.
She used the flask to hold water.
She needed a mask to wear at work.
She wanted one that was soft silk.
She found a soft mask that was under the bench.

title: The Pink Flask and the Desk-2
content:
She stood up fast and then made a crash!
Her flask fell down and the water went all over the desk.
She took a gasp.
“Oh no!”

title: The Pink Flask and the Desk-3
content:
The woman came to help.
She helped the girl clean the desk.
The girl said, “Thank you! I will be more careful with the flask next time!”

title: The Elf and the Wolf-1
content:
A little elf was in the tree.
He wanted to jump from one branch to the next.
He said, “This is the last jump I will make today.”
He had to grasp the new branch very tight.
The branch was thin and looked crisp.
He did not want to fall down!

title: The Elf and the Wolf-2
content:
He made a big jump!
He did not grasp the branch.
He made a loud crash! He was under the tree branch.
He took a gasp.

title: The Elf and the Wolf-3
content:
The wolf came over to help.
The wolf did not hurt the elf.
He helped the elf walk back to his home.
The elf was happy.

title: The Bench and the Lunch-1
content:
Two friends wanted to meet at camp.
They said, “Let’s sit on the bench for lunch.”
They both ran fast to the bench.
They made a pact to always share their food.
They said, “We will not infect each other with germs.”
They both had crisp apples to eat.

title: The Bench and the Lunch-2
content:
The boy tried to grasp his apple, but he fell down on the ground.
He took a gasp and was a little sad.
The girl helped him up.

title: The Bench and the Lunch-3
content:
She said, “Don’t worry.
You are the best friend.”
They went back to the bench and ate their lunch.
They were happy to play together.

title: The Duck on the Lawn-1
content:
A little duck was on the front lawn.
He was playing fast.
The boy said, “I want to catch that duck!”
The duck ran away.
The duck ran all the way to the beach.
The boy ran after him.

title: The Duck on the Lawn-2
content:
The boy took a gasp when he saw the water.
He did not want to swim.
The boy stopped.
He saw his best friend.
His friend said, “I will help you catch the duck!
We will work as a match.”

title: The Duck on the Lawn-3
content:
They ran and caught the duck and brought him back home.
The boy said, “Thank you, friend! We will not let the duck go away alone again.”

title: A Gold Flake on the Cake-1
content:
The big clock on the wall was very old.
The girl said, “It’s time to bake a cake!”
She put on her pink sock and went to the kitchen.
The girl opened the back door.

title: A Gold Flake on the Cake-2
content:
A witch was standing there!
The witch said, “I want to take your new cake!”
The girl had to act fast! She took a big gasp.
She said, “No, you can’t take it!”
The witch made a crash when she fell down on the front step.

title: A Gold Flake on the Cake-3
content:
The witch went away.
The girl was happy.
She put a gold flake on each piece of her cake.
She ate her cake for lunch.

title: The Sock and the Stitch-1
content:
My mom was working on her desk.
She saw a sock with a rip.
She said, “Oh no! I need to stitch this sock so it will not get gone.”
She needed a match to the thread.

title: The Sock and the Stitch-2
content:
She said, “I will make the best stitch so the sock will be strong again.”
She had to work fast.
Her little girl came in.
The girl said, “Mom, can you teach me to stitch?”

title: The Sock and the Stitch-3
content:
The mother said, “Yes, I can teach each stitch to you.”
The girl took her own sock and started to stitch.
She made a good stitch!
The mother said, “You are very good! Now you can help me stitch the whole quilt.”

title: The Peach and the Branch-1
content:
The boy was at the park.
He saw a tree with a big branch.
On the branch, there was a crisp peach.
He wanted to take it.
He said, “I will jump up to the branch.”
He tried to jump, but he could not grasp it.

title: The Peach and the Branch-2
content:
He looked at his bike.
He had an idea.
He brought his bike under the branch.
He stood on the bike seat and took the peach! He made a gasp when he bit into the peach.
It was very cold.

title: The Peach and the Branch-3
content:
He went to the bench for lunch.
He shared the peach with his friend.
He gave each friend a piece.
It was the best peach he had ever found.

title: The Eagle and the Fable-1
content:
A big eagle lived in the jungle.
He was the best hunter.
He would fly fast over the long tree branch.
The eagle saw a single cable running through the jungle.
He did not think it was simple.

title: The Eagle and the Fable-2
content:
He tried to grasp it with his hand and took a big gasp.
My uncle came to the jungle on his bike.
He saw the eagle.

title: The Eagle and the Fable-3
content:
He told the eagle a fable about a little duck.
The eagle was happy to hear the fable.
He flew away from the cable and promised to teach his friends the simple song.

title: A Cable in the Jungle-1
content:
A big eagle lived in the jungle.
He was the best hunter.
He would fly fast over the long tree branch.
The eagle saw a single cable running through the jungle.
He did not think it was simple.

title: A Cable in the Jungle-2
content:
He tried to grasp it with his hand and took a big gasp.
My uncle came to the jungle on his bike.
He saw the eagle.

title: A Cable in the Jungle-3
content:
He told the eagle a fable about a little duck.
The eagle was happy to hear the fable.
He flew away from the cable and promised to teach his friends the simple song.

title: The Temple and the Handle-1
content:
The girl went to the old temple.
She wanted to walk all the way to the back.
The temple had a big front door.

title: The Temple and the Handle-2
content:
She ran fast and then she fell down.
She hurt her ankle.
She made a yelp.
She took a gasp and was sad.
She needed help.

title: The Temple and the Handle-3
content:
A woman came to help her.
The woman said, “Here, grasp this handle and I will help you stand up.”
The girl held the handle tight.
The woman helped her walk back to the middle of the temple.
The girl said, “That was a simple act, but you are the best! Thank you.”

title: The Mule and the Mute Pup-1
content:
The baby was sleeping in the cradle.
The mother was happy.
The cradle had a soft quilt and was very old.
The baby only had one sock on his foot.
It was a single pink sock.
The mother said, “I need to find the match to this sock. ”

title: The Mule and the Mute Pup-2
content:
She looked all around the cradle.
She looked under the table.
She looked by the handle of the door.
She couldn’t find the match anywhere.

title: The Mule and the Mute Pup-3
content:
The father came home and told a fable about a baby elf.
The fable was simple and the best.
The baby in the cradle smiled in his sleep.
